column1: #text=This morning , my sister decided to bake a cake for her friend who was visiting from out of town .
#text=So , after stopping by the grocery store to buy some sugar , she gathered all of the ingredients and cooking utensils , she needed in her kitchen .
#text=She got butter , flour , cocoa powder , salt , baking powder , eggs , vanilla , and some buttermilk .
#text=Next , she preheated her oven to 350 degrees and greased her round baking pan with the butter .
#text=She then mixed all of the wet ingredients such as the eggs , vanilla , and buttermilk in a mixing bowl .
#text=For the dry ingredients like the flour , she mixed them separately in another , smaller bowl , where they were stirred together .
#text=Once this was done , the dry mixture was combined with the wet mixture and then they were were thoroughly stirred together .
#text=My sister then used a spatula to make sure all of the batter poured into the baking pan .
#text=After which , the pan was placed in the over for half an hour .
#text=When the cake was ready , she took the cake and set it on her kitchen counter to cool off for a few minutes .
#text=Finally , she placed it onto a plate and carefully put on some chocolate buttercream frosting .
#text=The cake was now ready for her friend to enjoy once she arrived .
